sense.name: the act of removing doubt or concern
sense.examples: Children need reassurance and praise. We have been given reassurances that the water is safe to drink. I have no reassurances that he will pay back the money.

sense.name: a reinsurance policy
sense.commentary: REASSURANCE[+entity][+artifact][+document][+legal][+policy][+reinsurance] Note: alternate form for 'reinsurance' An insurance policy that takes over the risk previously covered by another one.
sense.examples: Their firm purchased reassurance from a second insurance company. Does this reassurance of your home cover everything that the old policy did?
